contentrichtext.text: {{oneref|date=February 2011}} Formerly known as The '''United Kingdom Office for Library and Information Networking''', '''UKOLN''' is a centre of expertise in digital information management, providing advice and services to the library, information, education and cultural heritage communities. UKOLN is based at the [[University of Bath]] and is funded by the [[JISC]] as well as project funding from JISC and the [[European Union]]. ==History== UKOLN was established in 1989,<ref>[http://www.ukoln.ac.uk/services/papers/bl/blri009/anweb.htm UKOLN Annual Report 1995-6] contains a brief history of UKOLN</ref> although the organisation traces its roots back to 1977 with the foundation, by the [[British Library]], of the Centre for Catalogue Research. Between 1994 and 2000, the Director of UKOLN was [[Lorcan Dempsey]]. ==Work== UKOLN's main work is: *influencing policy and informing practice *promoting community-building and consensus making by actively raising awareness *advancing knowledge through research and development *building innovative systems and services based on Web technologies *acting as an agent for knowledge transfer. Its specialist areas include metadata and interoperability. It also publishes the [[Ariadne (Web magazine)]], targeted principally at [[information science]] professionals in academia, archives, libraries and museums. UKOLN also organises many events, including the annual [[IWMW|Institutional Web Management Workshop]]. ==References== <references/> ==External links== * [http://www.ukoln.ac.uk/ UKOLN Web site] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ukoln}} [[Category:Library-related organizations]] [[Category:Library science]] [[Category:Organisations based in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:University organizations]] [[Category:Information technology organisations]] [[Category:University of Bath]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1989]] [[Category:1989 establishments in the United Kingdom]] {{UK-org-stub}}
